summary: The 'Move the ICC Out of NYC Act of 2025' aims to prevent the International Criminal Court (ICC) from using United Nations facilities within the United States. The bill mandates the U.S. Ambassador to the UN to negotiate a supplemental agreement to the UN Headquarters Agreement. The bill cites the lack of U.S. ratification of the Rome Statute and the ICC's limited jurisdiction in the country as justification. The bill was introduced to the House of Representatives on March 4, 2025.
